TextEquiv.Unicode: For how so ever the Scripture doeth
witheloquent and sigurative speches,
with allusions and harde Sentences
most, plainely shew the shadow of that
life, and those ioyes, yet notwithstan
ding, all that is little or nothing in co
parison to speake of, untill that day do
come wherein we shall with unspeak
able ioye, beholde God himelfe, the
creator of al things in his glory, Christ
our saviour in his Maiestie, and final
ly all the blessed foules, Angels, Pa
triarches, Prophetes, Apostles, Mar
tyrs, our Fathers, all nations, all the
hoast of Heaven, and lastly the whole
divine and heavenlie glorie. Most
truely therefore sayde Aurelius Au
gustine, Lib, de Eivit. Dei. 22. Cap. 29.
when it is demaunded of mee what
the Saintes shall doe in that spirituall
bodie3. J aunswere not that which I
nowesee, but that that l beleeve. I say
therefore that they shall see God in
that spirituall bodie. And againe, If
I should saie the trueth, I knowe not
in what sorte that action, duietnesse
and rest shall be. For the peace of
God doth passe all understanding.
To be short, we shall see God face to
face, we shall be silled with the com
panie of God, and yet be never wearie

For how so ever the Scripture doeth witheloquent and sigurative speches, with allusions and harde Sentences most, plainely shew the shadow of that life, and those ioyes, yet notwithstan ding, all that is little or nothing in co parison to speake of, untill that day do come wherein we shall with unspeak able ioye, beholde God himelfe, the creator of al things in his glory, Christ our saviour in his Maiestie, and final ly all the blessed foules, Angels, Pa triarches, Prophetes, Apostles, Mar tyrs, our Fathers, all nations, all the hoast of Heaven, and lastly the whole divine and heavenlie glorie. Most truely therefore sayde Aurelius Au gustine, Lib, de Eivit. Dei. 22. Cap. 29. when it is demaunded of mee what the Saintes shall doe in that spirituall bodie3. J aunswere not that which I nowesee, but that that l beleeve. I say therefore that they shall see God in that spirituall bodie. And againe, If I should saie the trueth, I knowe not in what sorte that action, duietnesse and rest shall be. For the peace of God doth passe all understanding. To be short, we shall see God face to face, we shall be silled with the com panie of God, and yet be never wearie
of him. And the face of God is not that
countonaunce that appeareth in us,
but is a most delectable revealing and
inioying of God, which no mortall
tongue can worthily declare. Goe to
then (dearely beloved brethren) let us
believe and live, that when wee shall
depart from hence wee may in verie
deede have triall of those uuspeakable
ioyes of the eternal life to come, which I
nowe we doe believe.
Hitherto have I throughout the
foure last Articles declared unto you
the fruite and ende of Christian faith,
Faith leaneth upon one God the Fa
ther, the Sonne, and the holy Ghost,
which sanctifieth ye faithfull, & purgeth
and halloweth a Church to him elfe,
which Church hath a communion
with God and all saintes. All the
offences of which Church God pardo
neth and forgiveth. And doeth pre
serue it both soule and bodie. For as
the saints soules can not die, so God
rayseth up their bodies againe , and
maketh them glorious and everla
staing, to the end that the whole man
may for ever live in heaven, with.
the Lord: to whom be praise
and glory world with
out end. Amen.

of him. And the face of God is not that countonaunce that appeareth in us, but is a most delectable revealing and inioying of God, which no mortall tongue can worthily declare. Goe to then (dearely beloved brethren) let us believe and live, that when wee shall depart from hence wee may in verie deede have triall of those uuspeakable ioyes of the eternal life to come, which I nowe we doe believe. Hitherto have I throughout the foure last Articles declared unto you the fruite and ende of Christian faith, Faith leaneth upon one God the Fa ther, the Sonne, and the holy Ghost, which sanctifieth ye faithfull, & purgeth and halloweth a Church to him elfe, which Church hath a communion with God and all saintes. All the offences of which Church God pardo neth and forgiveth. And doeth pre serue it both soule and bodie. For as the saints soules can not die, so God rayseth up their bodies againe , and maketh them glorious and everla staing, to the end that the whole man may for ever live in heaven, with. the Lord: to whom be praise and glory world with out end. Amen.
Of the love of God and our Neighbour,
Of the love of God and our Neighbour,
T remaineth since
I have in some ser
mons discoursed of
true faith, that I do
nowe also adde one
Sermon touching
WFoGF love towards God
and our neighbour. For in my fourth
Sermon I promised so soone as I
should have done with the exposition
of faith, that then I would speake of

T remaineth since I have in some ser mons discoursed of true faith, that I do nowe also adde one Sermon touching WFoGF love towards God and our neighbour. For in my fourth Sermon I promised so soone as I should have done with the exposition of faith, that then I would speake of
love towarde God and our neighbourr
because the exposition of the Scrip
tures ought not to goe awrye out of
faith and charitie, which are as it
were the right and holy markes for it
to draw unto. Pea, as hitherto ye have
done, so cease not yet to pray, that this
wholesome docrine may bee by mee
taught as it shoulde be, and by you,
received with much increase and pro
fiet,

love towarde God and our neighbourr because the exposition of the Scrip tures ought not to goe awrye out of faith and charitie, which are as it were the right and holy markes for it to draw unto. Pea, as hitherto ye have done, so cease not yet to pray, that this wholesome docrine may bee by mee taught as it shoulde be, and by you, received with much increase and pro fiet,
